strategy_summary: ProFrac is navigating a soft North American completions market with fleet counts in the low-20s active, focused on technology differentiation through ProPilot 2.0 automation and the newly announced Seismos strategic partnership for closed-loop fracturing. A $100M cost savings program is underway alongside e-frac and dual-fuel fleet expansion.
capex_guidance: $160-190M for full-year 2025
technology_mentions: ProPilot 2.0 surface automation (up to 26% fuel economy improvement)
Real-time downhole performance auditing via Seismos
completions_strategy: ProPilot 2.0 handles surface automation while Seismos provides subsurface intelligence in two modes: supervised (real-time decision-making with operator) and unsupervised (fully automated adjustments). Seismos described as 'independent auditor for downhole performance.' Combined offering positions ProFrac for closed-loop fracturing differentiation in a commoditizing market.
seismos_relevance_detail: ProFrac explicitly names Seismos as a strategic partner and describes closed-loop fracturing capabilities in the call. Quote: 'Strategic partnership with Seismos... closed-loop fracturing capabilities that represent the next evolution in completion solutions.' Two-mode CLF (supervised and unsupervised) described. Seismos positioned as independent downhole auditor complementing ProPilot 2.0 surface automation. Machina CLF integration is the commercial offering.
notable_quote: Seismos acts as an independent auditor for downhole performance, introducing closed-loop fracturing capabilities that represent the next evolution in completion solutions.

strategy_summary: Halliburton is leaning into completions technology differentiation through Zeus IQ (real-time automated completions platform), e-frac adoption, and international expansion. North America revenue pressure offset by technology premium and international growth.
completions_strategy: Zeus IQ automated completions platform saw 8% QoQ adoption increase. Pushing real-time completions intelligence as a differentiation lever against Liberty and ProFrac.
efficiency_metrics: Zeus IQ customers see 15-20% improvement in stage efficiency
seismos_relevance_reason: Zeus IQ is a direct competitor to Seismos CLF. 8% QoQ adoption increase signals accelerating market acceptance of real-time completions intelligence.
notable_quote: Zeus IQ represents the future of completions optimization

strategy_summary: Liberty Energy delivered resilient 2025 results ($4.0B revenue, $634M adj EBITDA) and is pivoting aggressively into distributed power (LPI) targeting 3 GW by 2029. Core completions business faces mid-single-digit pricing pressure in 2026 with flat revenue guidance. Technology differentiation via Atlas/Atlas IQ completions intelligence platform and digiFleet automation.
capex_guidance: ~$250M completions capex in 2026; $275-350M power equipment deposits + $450-550M project capex (project-financed)
technology_mentions: Atlas cloud-based completions data platform (deployed with every Liberty crew)
Atlas IQ AI-powered assistant with natural language queries across operational data
completions_strategy: Continuous operations, multi-frac jobs, automation, and transparency cited as 'flight to quality' differentiators as lower-tier competition exits. Atlas IQ provides real-time operational data and AI-powered insights to completion crews. 14% reduction in maintenance costs per unit of work achieved via AI optimization. Building 3-4 additional digiFleets in 2026.
seismos_relevance_detail: Liberty Energy is a Seismos partner (pumping company agnostic is Seismos's pitch, but Liberty is a key channel). Atlas IQ is a direct completions intelligence platform — a competitive/complementary product to Seismos's SAFA analytics. Liberty's emphasis on real-time operational data, AI-assisted decision-making during frac jobs, and automation parallels Seismos's CLF value proposition. Liberty's pricing headwinds in 2026 create both risk (budget pressure) and opportunity (tech differentiation argument). Atlas IQ launch is the most important competitive signal to monitor.
notable_quote: Fewer crews are available to meet any incremental completions demand — a flight to quality favoring providers that can deliver multi-frac jobs, continuous operations, and automation and transparency.

strategy_summary: Magnolia delivered 11% production growth to ~100,000 BOE/d in 2025 with field-level cash operating costs down 7% to $5.12/BOE, generating $425M+ FCF of which ~75% was returned to shareholders. Giddings (Eagle Ford) drilling efficiency improved 8% in drilled feet per day and 6% in completed feet per day, with well costs trending toward ~$1,000/ft from ~$1,100/ft. 2026 guidance targets ~5% production growth with flat D&C capital of $440-480M, remaining completely unhedged.
capex_guidance: $440-480M D&C and facility capital 2026; ~$125M Q1 2026 (highest quarterly rate); no additional rigs planned
basin_focus: Eagle Ford / Giddings field (South Texas); company-wide South Texas focus with horizontal drilling and multi-stage completions
technology_mentions: Completion efficiency gains in Giddings: 8% improvement in drilled feet/day, 6% improvement in completed feet/day; well costs ~$1,000/ft trending down from $1,100/ft; improved well placement cited for outperformance vs type curves
completions_strategy: Multi-stage horizontal completions in Eagle Ford/Giddings; 8,000-8,500 ft typical lateral length; well cost optimization toward $1,000/ft; consistency with same rigs/crews/equipment over multi-year periods cited as key to efficiency; completion deferrals in H1 2025 enabled by strong early productivity
service_provider_mentions: Service costs described as 'flat to slightly down' for 2026; key providers locked in for H1 2026; no specific vendors named
metrics_reported: FY2025 production 100,000 BOE/d (+11%); Q4 2025 record 103,800 BOE/d; oil production ~40,000 bpd; field-level cash OpEx $5.12/BOE (-7%); D&C capital $461M; organic proved developed F&D $9.25/BOE; FCF >$425M; diluted shares -4.5%
seismos_relevance_detail: Magnolia is an EXISTING Seismos CLF case study customer operating in the Eagle Ford/Giddings. This earnings call confirms continued focus on completion efficiency optimization in Giddings, improved drilled and completed feet per day, and well cost reduction — all areas where Seismos CLF delivers documented value. Completion deferrals and improved well placement language aligns with CLF-driven optimization. Strong candidate for expanded engagement and case study refresh given active 2026 program with $440-480M D&C spend.
notable_quote: 8% increase in drilled feet per day and 6% improvement in completed feet per day during 2025

strategy_summary: Ovintiv is executing a $2.3B capital program focused on Permian and Montney after divesting Anadarko assets. Company is achieving step-change completions efficiency through continuous pumping (7-day straight runs), real-time frac optimization algorithms, and surfactant adoption (300 Permian wells, 9% oil productivity uplift). Well costs targeting <$600/ft Permian and <$500/ft Montney.
capex_guidance: $2.3B total 2026; <$600/ft Permian, <$500/ft Montney target
technology_mentions: Real-time frac optimization with proprietary algorithms
Continuous pumping (7-day straight operational run achieved)
Surfactants (300 Permian wells, 9% oil productivity improvement)
Drive Center AI platform for drilling optimization
completions_strategy: Continuous pumping is a central focus — achieved 20% improvement in completed feet per day, averaging 4,250 ft/day with 7-day straight runs. Proprietary real-time frac optimization algorithms adjust treatment parameters during pumping. Surfactants credited for half of type curve improvement since 2022. Ovintiv explicitly owns its frac optimization IP internally.
seismos_relevance_detail: Ovintiv's 'real-time frac optimization with proprietary algorithms' is the most direct competitive signal in the operator universe — they are doing in-house what Seismos sells as SAFA/CLF. This makes Ovintiv both a potential target customer (if their proprietary solution has gaps) and a competitive intelligence data point showing operator appetite for real-time optimization. The 9% oil uplift from surfactants and continuous pumping metrics also define the ROI benchmarks Seismos must meet or beat. Continuous pumping focus means any downtime (plug-and-perf issues Seismos addresses) is a high-pain point.
notable_quote: We achieved a seven-day continuous pumping run and a 20% improvement in completed feet per day, driven by real-time frac optimization using proprietary algorithms.

strategy_summary: Permian Resources is driving aggressive D&C cost reductions and completions efficiency gains through simul-frac optimization in the Delaware Basin. The company reduced D&C cost to $700/ft and targets $675/ft in 2026, while acquiring more inventory than drilled for the third consecutive year and growing production 5% with lower capex.
capex_guidance: $1.85B total ($1.45B D&C, $400M non-D&C), down $120M YoY
technology_mentions: surfactants and acids on producing wells
completions_strategy: Increased completed lateral feet per day by 20% YoY through simul-frac efficiency improvements. Drilling 2-mile wells in ~13 days spud-to-rig release. Average lateral length of 11,000 ft in 2026 with longest lateral at ~17,000 ft. Experimenting with surfactants and acids on existing producing wells with mixed results - some wells showing double or triple production rates.
efficiency_metrics: D&C cost per foot: $700 (Q4 2024) targeting $675 (2026), ~20% reduction vs 2024. Drilling feet per day up 6% YoY. Completed lateral feet per day up 20% YoY. 2-mile wells: ~13 days spud-to-rig release. LOE: $5.26/BOE, cash G&A: $0.80/BOE, GP&T: $1.18/BOE.
seismos_relevance_reason: Pure-play Delaware Basin operator actively pushing completions technology boundaries with simul-frac optimization and 20% YoY completion efficiency gains. Experimenting with well intervention techniques. Heavy focus on D&C cost reduction and completion speed optimization aligns directly with CLF value proposition. Scale of operations (415K BOE/d) and tech-forward culture make PR a strong Seismos prospect.
notable_quote: There is more juice to squeeze on the cost side...on the drilling side.

strategy_summary: ProPetro navigated a contracting Permian frac market (~70 active fleets vs prior 90-100) by generating strong Q4 FCF from its completions business and pivoting growth capital toward PROPWR, its power generation business targeting 1 GW by 2030. The company is investing in fleet automation technology, FORCE electric frac fleet buyouts, and direct-drive gas frac units, while maintaining pricing discipline and keeping majority of fleets under contract. PROPWR has 240 MW committed and 550 MW on order including a data center contract.
capex_guidance: 2026 total CapEx $390-435M; completions $140-160M (incl. FORCE lease buyouts $40-50M); PROPWR $250-275M
basin_focus: Permian Basin exclusively (frac); national power market including data centers for PROPWR
technology_mentions: FORCE electric frac fleets (5 fleets, lease buyout in 2026-2028); Tier IV DGB fleets (7 fleets); direct-drive gas frac units (pilot, adding gradually); fleet automation technology investment; wireline (Silvertip); cementing; PROPWR (natural gas recip generators 70% / modular turbines 30% at $1.1M/MW)
completions_strategy: Maintaining ~11 active frac fleets Q1 2026 (down from Permian peak); majority under contract for stability; refurbishing Tier IV DGB fleet; adding direct-drive gas units selectively; fleet automation upgrades for customer fine-tuning and internal predictive maintenance; pricing discipline — will not run at subeconomic rates
service_provider_mentions: Caterpillar Financial Services (FORCE fleet financing, $157M facility); Stonebriar Commercial Finance ($350M leasing facility); no upstream technology vendors named
metrics_reported: Q4 revenue $290M; Q4 adjusted EBITDA $51M (18% margin, +45% QoQ); Q4 completions FCF $98M; Permian ~70 active fleets (market); PROPWR 240 MW committed, 550 MW on order, target 750 MW by end-2028 / 1 GW by 2030; equity offering raised ~$163M net
seismos_relevance_detail: ProPetro is a Seismos partner and key distribution channel — as one of the 'big three' Permian pumpers alongside Liberty and ProFrac. The transcript confirms ProPetro is investing heavily in fleet automation and technology to support customer frac optimization, directly complementary to SAFA/CLF. Their FORCE electric fleet and technology investment narrative aligns with Seismos positioning. Continued Permian-only focus means any CLF/SAFA deployment would go through ProPetro. Key account for partnership expansion and Machina integration.
notable_quote: Fleet automation technology investment allows customers to fine-tune completions programs at the highest level

strategy_summary: Trican delivered strong Q4 results (CAD $322.7M revenue, 23% EBITDA) driven by Iron Horse acquisition and a 70/30 gas/oil work mix. The company is differentiating as the only Canadian basin provider offering a 'full suite' of electric assets on location, investing CAD $40M in 100% natural gas Caterpillar 3520 frac pumpers (first units received, field deployment Q2 2026, 10-pump spread by fall), and is 'incredibly bullish' on Montney/Duvernay driven by LNG export capacity growth.
capex_guidance: CAD $120M 2026 capital program (~50% expansion including ~CAD $40M natural gas frac fleet); maintenance ~CAD $60M
basin_focus: Western Canada - Montney (dominant), Duvernay, Cardium, SAGD (Christina Lake expansion), Eastern Alberta/Saskatchewan/Central Alberta (Iron Horse acquisition)
technology_mentions: Natural gas frac pumpers (Cat 3520, 100% NG - first in fleet), electric ancillary frac equipment (full suite - only provider in basin), AI for cementing blending error reduction, hybrid cementing unit development, natural gas semi-trucks, electrification of ancillary support equipment
completions_strategy: Deep frac differentiation via natural gas pumping and full electric ancillary suite; demand for electric assets exceeds supply; trends toward longer wells and higher sand volumes; growing logistics business as customer-supplied sand increases; cementing expansion into SAGD (Christina Lake) market; coil tubing setting depth/horizontal records in Montney/Duvernay
service_provider_mentions: Caterpillar (natural gas frac pumpers - Cat 3520); Iron Horse Frac (acquired); Centrica implied (customer LNG contracts referenced)
metrics_reported: Q4 revenue: CAD $322.7M (vs CAD $275.5M prior year); EBITDA: CAD $73.4M (23% margin); FCF: CAD $46.6M; net debt: CAD $79.9M (~0.3x leverage); shares repurchased: 12.1M in FY2025; cementing Q4 revenue/jobs: +33% YoY; work mix: ~70% gas / 30% oil
seismos_relevance_detail: Trican is a direct target for Seismos CLF partnership in the Canadian market. As the dominant Canadian pressure pumper with strong Montney/Duvernay market position and a technology-forward posture (electric fleet, NG pumpers, AI tools), Trican is exactly the type of pumping company Seismos targets. Their active expansion into electric/NG fleets and customer demand for efficiency and lower emissions creates a natural CLF value proposition. Trican's SAGD cementing expansion into Christina Lake and emphasis on customer technology roadmaps is additional signal. No current Seismos relationship mentioned, making this a greenfield opportunity.
notable_quote: Only provider in the basin offering a full suite of electric assets on frac location

strategy_summary: APA exceeded cost reduction targets, generating $1B+ FCF in 2025 with net debt below $4B, and expects to exit 2026 at a $450M controllable spend run-rate. The Permian is APA's foundational asset with ~450k net acres; 2026 capital of $1.3B targets flat Permian oil production at 120-122k bpd while D&C costs improved to $595/lateral foot (Midland) and $750/lateral foot (Delaware). Suriname GranMorgu targets mid-2028 first oil with $230M of 2026 capital.
capex_guidance: $1.3B U.S. 2026 capital (~$1.2B Permian D&C + $100M base capital); ~$230M Suriname GranMorgu; ~$70M exploration; total 2026 capex not explicitly stated but ~$1.6B implied
basin_focus: Permian Basin (Midland and Texas-Delaware, 450k net acres); Egypt (gas-weighted growth, 540-550 MMcfd gross gas 2026); Suriname (GranMorgu development, mid-2028 first oil)
technology_mentions: Drilling and completion cost reductions ($595/ft Midland, $750/ft Delaware); artificial lift investments; compression and facilities consolidation; no specific frac diagnostics technology mentioned
completions_strategy: D&C cost discipline with Midland at $595/lateral foot (periods under $500); Delaware at $750/ft (some under $700 shallow); 4-well appraisal test in shallow Delaware (Avalon/Bone Spring) late 2026; 2026 program holds Permian oil flat at 120-122k bpd; technical upside inventory conversion via delineation
metrics_reported: Q4 FCF $425M; FY2025 FCF >$1B; net debt <$4B; proved reserves +9% to >1B boe; all-in RRR >160%; Permian D&C costs $595/ft Midland, $750/ft Delaware; Egypt Q4 gross gas 501 MMcfd
seismos_relevance_detail: APA is active in the Permian (Midland and Delaware) with a cost-reduction and capital-efficiency focus on completions. D&C cost reduction and technical inventory conversion suggest interest in frac performance optimization tools. However, no completions diagnostics, real-time frac monitoring, or CLF technology was mentioned. Medium relevance as a Permian operator prospect.
notable_quote: We see a clear line of sight to incremental free cash flow from Suriname beginning in 2028

strategy_summary: Antero is pursuing aggressive production growth from 3.4 to 4.1 Bcfe/d in 2026, driven by the HG Energy acquisition that added 385,000 net acres and 400+ drilling locations. The company reduced its cost structure by ~10% and is positioning for $3+ gas pricing with flexible growth capital that can be deferred or accelerated based on market conditions.
capex_guidance: ~$1B D&C capital (maintenance ~$900M, up to $200M discretionary growth)
completions_strategy: Record 19 stages/day on single crew in Q4 2025; company-wide average over 14 stages/day, up 8% YoY. Running 3 rigs and 2 completion crews described as most capital-efficient configuration. HG Energy acreage enables bigger pads, wider spacing, and bigger completions with better recoveries. Average lateral length increasing to 15,000 ft from 13,000 ft driven by HG acreage. Drilling days below 5 per 10,000 ft, improving 4% from 2024.
efficiency_metrics: Record 19 stages/day (single crew), 14+ stages/day company-wide (up 8% YoY). Drilling days <5 per 10,000 ft (4% improvement). Cash costs reduced ~10% ($0.25 improvement). Adjusted EBITDAX $422.1M in Q4, up 27% YoY. $750M+ FCF for full year 2025.
seismos_relevance_reason: Active completions operator setting frac efficiency records and focused on optimizing completion designs for HG Energy acreage. Emphasis on bigger completions and wider spacing. However, no specific mentions of CLF, acoustic sensing, real-time frac monitoring, or digital completions technologies.
notable_quote: We set numerous company records in 2025, including a record 19 stages per day on a single completion crew in Q4.

strategy_summary: BKV delivered 8% exit-to-exit organic production growth in its first full public year, setting internal completions efficiency records above 22 HP-hours/day and lowering D&C costs to $545/ft - peer-leading for gas. Strategy centers on a 'closed-loop' upstream/power/CCUS platform targeting hyperscaler PPAs from its 1.5 GW Temple gas plant. Barnett refracs and POW (positive offset well) production management are key differentiators.
capex_guidance: $410-$560M gross 2026 capex; $240M upstream development; $135M strategic power capital
basin_focus: Barnett Shale (Fort Worth Basin, dominant position), NE Pennsylvania
technology_mentions: AI and big data for well optimization and decline management, completions efficiency benchmarking (HP-hours/day), refrac program, positive offset well (POW) analysis, carbon capture (CCUS/Barnett Zero), Upper Barnett appraisal
completions_strategy: Disciplined multi-stage completions with efficiency records; active refrac program on Bedrock DUCs; focus on POW production uplift (~22% above type curve through 150 days); Upper Barnett appraisal wells planned for 2026
metrics_reported: Production: 940 MMcfe/d Q4; completions efficiency >22 HP-hours/day; D&C cost $545/ft; POW uplift ~22% above type curve through 150 days; 8% exit-to-exit growth; reserves ~6 Tcfe 1P
seismos_relevance_detail: BKV's emphasis on completions efficiency records, POW production analysis, and AI-driven optimization in a mature Barnett play creates a relevant entry point for Seismos real-time diagnostics. Refracs and DUC completions on Bedrock assets are near-term opportunities. However, BKV is a gas-focused mid-size operator in the Barnett - not a Permian/unconventional oil operator - and no direct frac diagnostics or CLF language was used. Relevance is process/efficiency driven rather than diagnostic.
notable_quote: We set multiple internal records above 22 horsepower-hours per day

strategy_summary: BP executed a turnaround in 2025 with $2B in structural cost reductions, 7 major project startups, and record plant reliability above 96%, while suspending buybacks to accelerate balance sheet repair targeting $14-18B net debt by 2027. BPX Lower 48 achieved 20% improvement in completion time and 9% improvement in drilling time, representing significant capital productivity gains. AI and digital twins are deployed for real-time reservoir/wells/facilities monitoring across operations.
capex_guidance: $13-13.5B organic CapEx 2026 (low end of prior guidance range); 2026 production ~2.3 MMboe/d broadly flat
basin_focus: BPX Lower 48 (Permian, Eagle Ford, Haynesville), Gulf of America (Paleogene/Kaskida/Tiber), Brazil (Bumerangue discovery ~8B bbl in place), Azerbaijan, North Sea
technology_mentions: Dynamic digital twins, AI/automation for real-time reservoir/wells/facilities monitoring; 'Wells Adviser' AI system for wellsite decisions; AI kick detection (90% success rate); BPX 20% completion time improvement, 9% drilling time improvement; geo-steering for horizontal wells
completions_strategy: BPX 20% improvement in completion time enabling 8-rig equivalent of prior 10-rig program; geo-steering long undulating horizontals; 3/4 of wells in top or second quartile; first/second quartile focus in Permian, Eagle Ford, Haynesville
service_provider_mentions: Transocean (Mykonos deepwater rig for Brazil appraisal); no completions service vendors named
metrics_reported: FY2025 underlying RC profit $7.5B; OCF $24.5B; CapEx $14.5B; adjusted FCF ~$13B; ROACE 14% price-adjusted; reserves replacement 90%; plant reliability >96%; wells reliability ~98%; BPX average IRR 45% at $65 WTI
seismos_relevance_detail: BPX completion efficiency gains (20% improvement) and real-time monitoring via AI/digital twins are directly relevant to Seismos CLF value proposition. BPX operates in Permian, Eagle Ford, and Haynesville — all Seismos target basins. However, no specific completions diagnostics technology named. AI monitoring emphasis signals openness to real-time optimization tools like SAFA.
notable_quote: 20% improvement in completion time, 9% improvement in drilling time

strategy_summary: Chord is executing a low-to-no oil growth strategy focused on free cash flow maximization and capital efficiency in the Bakken. The company converted 80% of inventory to long laterals ahead of schedule, reducing weighted average breakeven by over 10%, and is trialing surfactant/chemical treatments to enhance well performance.
completions_strategy: One full-time frac crew with spot crew releasing mid-summer. Five drilling rigs balanced between 3-mile and 4-mile laterals. Approximately 80% of TILs expected to be longer laterals. Actively trialing 19 surfactant and chemical treatments to enhance well performance and evaluating alternative well geometries.
efficiency_metrics: F&D costs declined 22% over several years. Weighted average breakeven fell >10% in 2025. Capital spending $60M below plan in 2025. Marketing/midstream savings of $30-50M annual run-rate. $160M total FCF improvement from controllable factors in 2025.
seismos_relevance_reason: Actively trialing completions innovations including surfactant treatments and alternative well geometries. Early adopter mentality on technology when results merit. However, Bakken-focused with limited Permian exposure and only one full-time frac crew limits near-term CLF opportunity.
notable_quote: We have pumped 19 chemical and surfactant treatments already, and we are evaluating those results.

strategy_summary: Core Laboratories delivered 7% YoY revenue growth to $138.3M in Q4 2025, driven by strong demand for completion diagnostic services across US onshore and offshore markets despite missing EPS forecasts. The company is expanding its proprietary SpectraStim proppant tracer diagnostics for evaluating plugless completion designs and diverter-based stage isolation, while the Pulverizer plug-and-abandonment system won a global innovation award. Management maintained its three financial tenets: maximize free cash flow, maximize ROIC, and return excess cash to shareholders.
capex_guidance: $15-$18 million for 2026 (excluding UK facility rebuild, which is insurance-covered); 2-4% of revenue
production_guidance: Q1 2026 revenue guidance: $124-$130 million; operating income $9.7-$12.2 million (~9% margin); EPS $0.11-$0.15
completions_strategy: Strong demand for proprietary completion diagnostic services across US onshore and offshore markets. SpectraStim deployed to evaluate plugless completion designs using diverter-based stage isolation, confirming stimulation effectiveness across multi-stage laterals. Trimmer Frac Diagnostics supporting complex US land completion designs with limited-entry perforations and extended lateral lengths. Production Enhancement segment revenue $46M (up 8% YoY) despite sequential margin compression from Asia Pacific receivable provision.
efficiency_metrics: Service revenue $107M (up 6% sequentially, up 11% YoY); Production Enhancement margins 7% Q4 vs 11% Q3; net debt reduced to $90.2M (leverage ratio 1.09); net debt reduced $205.8M (70%) since Q4 2019; tariff headwind $0.02-$0.03/share per quarter
seismos_relevance_reason: Core Laboratories is adjacent to Seismos in the frac diagnostics space - their SpectraStim proppant tracers and Trimmer Frac Diagnostics directly evaluate completion effectiveness, the same outcome CLF/acoustic sensing targets. They are a potential competitor in diagnostics-as-a-service for operators evaluating completions. However, Core's approach is post-job chemical/tracer-based while Seismos provides real-time acoustic monitoring during pumping - making them potentially complementary rather than purely competitive. Worth monitoring as a partnership or competitive reference.
notable_quote: Core deployed its proprietary SpectraStim proppant tracer diagnostics to assess diverter-based stage isolation and to verify stimulation effectiveness across the multiple stage laterals.

strategy_summary: ConocoPhillips is focused on capital discipline post-Marathon acquisition, targeting 15%+ D&C efficiency improvements. Permian and Eagle Ford remain core development areas with growing Lower 48 production.
completions_strategy: Driving 15%+ D&C efficiency improvement through simul-frac deployment, longer laterals, and optimized completion designs. Marathon integration expanding completions scale.
efficiency_metrics: 15%+ D&C efficiency improvement target, expanding 3-mile laterals
seismos_relevance_reason: Major completions spender with active efficiency improvement program. 15%+ D&C efficiency target and simul-frac adoption make them a strong CLF target account.
notable_quote: We see significant runway for continued D&C efficiency improvements across our portfolio

company: Crescent Point Energy Corp. (now Veren Inc., acquired by Whitecap Resources May 2025)
strategy_summary: Crescent Point Energy rebranded to Veren Inc. (TSX/NYSE: VRN) in May 2024 and was acquired by Whitecap Resources (TSX: WCP) in May 2025, ceasing to exist as an independent public company. The ticker CPG no longer trades as of May 2025. Veren's final standalone Q4 2024 results (reported February 27, 2025) showed 188,721 boe/d production (+16% YoY), with 77% of production from Alberta Montney and Kaybob Duvernay. Whitecap absorbed Veren's assets and reports Q4 2025 results under WCP ticker with 307,245 boe/d record 2025 production.
capex_guidance: Veren's 2025 standalone capex was not tracked (acquired in May 2025). Whitecap (post-Veren merger) 2026 capital budget: CAD $2.0-2.1 billion, split 75% unconventional / 25% conventional. Whitecap is building Lator 04-13 facility for 11 net Montney wells in 2026, targeted completion Q4 2026.
production_guidance: Veren (standalone) 2025 guidance was 188,000-196,000 boe/d at time of Q4 2024 results. Whitecap post-merger 2026 guidance: 370,000-375,000 boe/d (Q4 2026 exit rate 380,000 boe/d), representing 22% growth vs. 2025 average. Montney and Duvernay assets ~75-80% of unconventional capital.
technology_mentions: Single Point Entry (SPE) completion designs in Carr (Alberta Montney) - 30% above type well IP30
Gas egress infrastructure expansion (Gold Creek West)
completions_strategy: Veren/Crescent Point was actively testing Single Point Entry (SPE) completion designs in the Alberta Montney at Carr, achieving 30% above type well IP30 rates (average peak 30-day rate of 1,270 boe/d per well at 80% oil cut). SPE design expanded to Karr and Gold Creek in 2025. Kaybob Duvernay completions delivered 25% above type well IP30 rates. Completions innovation was a key operational differentiator. No CLF or real-time frac monitoring mentioned.
efficiency_metrics: Veren Q4 2024: 188,721 boe/d production; adjusted funds flow $619.6M ($1.01/share); net debt reduced 35% to $2.48B; Montney/Duvernay 77% of production. SPE completion design: 1,270 boe/d per well peak 30-day rate (30% above type well). Whitecap post-merger: $300M realized synergies vs. $210M target.
seismos_relevance_reason: Veren/Crescent Point was an active completions innovator in the Alberta Montney and Kaybob Duvernay, testing SPE completion designs and tracking per-well performance improvements. The focus on completion design optimization represents a potential entry point for Seismos technology. However, the company no longer exists as an independent entity (absorbed into Whitecap in May 2025). Future engagement would be through Whitecap Resources (WCP).
notable_quote: Veren Q4 2024 call: CEO Craig Bryksa stated 'We continue to be excited about the quality of our asset base.' SPE completion design at Carr generated 'average peak 30-day rate of 1,270 boe/d per well, 30% above the area type well' at 80% oil cut.

strategy_summary: Crescent completed a sweeping portfolio transformation in 2025, executing ~$5 billion in transactions to become a focused three-basin operator in the Eagle Ford, Permian, and Uinta. The 2026 focus shifts to integration and synergy delivery, targeting $190 million annual run-rate synergies (doubled from original targets) while running a 6-7 rig program and expanding simulfrac adoption to drive D&C cost efficiency.
capex_guidance: $1.3 billion+ development capital program for 2026
production_guidance: 320-335 MBoe/d for 2026 (~25% YoY increase); relatively flat oil volumes in Eagle Ford and Permian throughout 2026
completions_strategy: Expanding simulfrac to 70% of South Texas pads; increasing Eagle Ford lateral lengths by ~2,000 feet through strategic land trades; D&C costs per foot declined 15% YoY. Running 4 Eagle Ford rigs, 1 Uinta rig, 1-2 Permian rigs.
efficiency_metrics: D&C cost per foot down 15% YoY; $190M annual synergy run-rate (doubled); targeting ~7% reduction in adjusted operating expenses vs. full-year 2025; base decline rate targeting 25% or below within 12-18 months
seismos_relevance_reason: Active completions program with simulfrac adoption and extended laterals across Eagle Ford (core Seismos basin) and Uinta creates real-time frac optimization opportunity. 70% simulfrac penetration in South Texas and cost-efficiency focus make CLF/acoustic diagnostics a compelling add-on, though no technology vendors were named on the call.
notable_quote: We are now a focused and scaled operator in three premier basins: the Eagle Ford, the Permian, and the Uinta.

strategy_summary: Comstock is aggressively developing the Western Haynesville play while doubling wells turned to sales from 12 to 24 in 2026. The company is pursuing a transformative behind-the-meter data center power strategy with NextEra (2-8 GW potential) and investing in rig upgrades to 10,000 PSI and 20,000 PSI frac fleet capabilities.
capex_guidance: $1.4-$1.5 billion D&E capex plus $100-$150 million midstream (2026)
completions_strategy: Ramping from 8 to 9 operated rigs with 4 devoted to Western Haynesville. Plans to drill 47 wells and turn 48 to sales in 2026. Western Haynesville wells averaging 33 MMcf/d IP. Upgrading to 10,000 PSI rig by late summer and planning 20,000 PSI frac fleet upgrade. 11% YoY reduction in D&C costs for legacy assets. Two Western Haynesville wells per month and four legacy wells per month completion pace.
efficiency_metrics: 11% YoY reduction in D&C costs for legacy Haynesville. Finding cost of $1.02/Mcfe. 229% reserve replacement ratio. Western Haynesville wells at 33 MMcf/d average IP vs. 25 MMcf/d legacy.
seismos_relevance_reason: Comstock is a major Haynesville completions spender ($1.4-1.5B capex) with active technology adoption including 20,000 PSI frac fleet upgrades and rotary steerable systems. The high-pressure Western Haynesville development and aggressive completions pace (48 wells to sales in 2026) present potential for frac diagnostics and optimization. No specific CLF or acoustic sensing mentions.
notable_quote: Comstock plans to increase the number of operating drilling rigs from eight to nine during 2026, with four devoted to the Western Haynesville.

strategy_summary: Coterra is merging with Devon Energy in a $58B all-stock deal expected to close Q2 2026, creating a super-independent with dominant Delaware Basin position and diversified Marcellus/Eagle Ford/Williston portfolio. Standalone 2026 guidance targets 5%+ annual oil growth with sub-50% reinvestment rate, while the Marcellus program delivers best-in-class returns.

production_guidance: 750-810 MBoepd total, 162-172 MBopd oil, 2,775-2,975 MMcfpd gas (2026 standalone)
completions_strategy: Ran nine rigs in Permian in H2 2025; maintained second rig in Marcellus through 2025 due to record-setting well performance. efficiency_metrics: Marcellus wells: 11 wells turned online Dec 2024 with peak 30-day rate of 450 MMcf/d. 2025 reinvestment rate of 54%. Generated $2.0B free cash flow (up 67% YoY). Integration yielded lower operating costs and optimized midstream commitments.
seismos_relevance_reason: Major Permian operator with active Delaware Basin completions program and focus on completions optimization through landing zone development. Pending Devon merger will create massive combined completions operation. No specific frac technology mentions but scale of operations presents opportunity.
notable_quote: Our Marcellus program is our best return right now.

strategy_summary: Devon announced a merger with Coterra Energy, creating a $3.5B upstream capex combined entity. Pre-merger Devon is executing a business optimization program targeting $1B in savings (85% achieved). Technology focus is on AI-enabled artificial lift optimization, condition-based maintenance, and Fervo geothermal investment. Delaware Basin focus with 90% NM activity.
capex_guidance: $3.5B upstream capex (combined Devon+Coterra basis)
technology_mentions: 100+ active work streams for operational improvement
completions_strategy: Devon's primary technology narrative is production optimization (artificial lift, condition-based maintenance) rather than completions diagnostics. Delaware Basin mix is 40% Wolfcamp, 45% Bone Spring, 15% Avalon. Merger with Coterra creates scale efficiency rationale. No CLF or acoustic frac diagnostics mentioned.
seismos_relevance_detail: Devon's AI-enabled optimization focus shows operator appetite for data-driven performance tools, though the emphasis is production rather than completions. Post-Coterra merger, the combined entity will be a large Permian operator with significant completion activity — a future enterprise target for Seismos. The merger itself may delay technology vendor decisions as organizations integrate. Condition-based maintenance philosophy is compatible with Seismos's real-time diagnostics pitch.
notable_quote: We've deployed AI-enabled artificial lift optimization and condition-based maintenance across our portfolio, contributing to the $850 million in business optimization savings achieved to date.

strategy_summary: Ecopetrol's Q4 2025 and full-year results are scheduled for release on March 4, 2026 (not yet available as of February 27, 2026). Based on Q3 2025 data, the company achieved average production of 751,000 boe/d for the first nine months of 2025, at the upper end of guidance, with EBITDA of COP 12.3 trillion (+11% QoQ) and proven reserves replacement ratio of 121%. The company faces a more challenging 2026 price environment and is focused on capital discipline.

production_guidance: 2025 full-year guidance: 740,000-750,000 boe/d (at upper end as of Q3 2025). 2026 production plan under development as of Q3 2025; formal guidance expected March 4-5, 2026. Permian Basin contributed ~106,000 boe/d net before royalties (14% of total production).

Tertiary recovery via air injection at Chichimene field
Enhanced recovery representing 41% of total output
Green hydrogen plant (Colombia's largest) started operations

This represents active completions optimization. Colombian operations focus on conventional enhanced recovery. No CLF or real-time frac monitoring mentioned.
efficiency_metrics: Permian: lower cost per foot drilled and per barrel pumped vs. plan via frac design optimization. EBITDA margin 41% in Q3 2025. Refining throughput 413,000 bbl/d in Q3 2025 (post-maintenance recovery). Transportation throughput 1,098,000 bbl/d.
seismos_relevance_reason: Ecopetrol operates in the Permian Basin (Midland) and explicitly discussed completions optimization including lower fracture pressures and new well designs as efficiency levers. As a significant Permian operator with active completion design work, there is a plausible entry point for Seismos CLF technology. However, no real-time frac monitoring or diagnostic technology was mentioned by name.
notable_quote: Q3 2025 call (November 14, 2025): 'Reductions in operating times and costs in the Permian were achieved thanks to new well designs, lower fracture pressures, and pumping times, which resulted in lower costs per foot drilled and per barrel pumped compared to the plan.'

strategy_summary: EOG is running a $6.5B 2026 capex program across Delaware, Utica, Eagle Ford, and Dorado with 24 rigs and 10 completion crews. Well costs declined 7% in 2025 with low single-digit further reductions targeted in 2026. Super Zipper high-intensity completions are a core operational focus, with ML-based production optimizers deployed across the portfolio.
capex_guidance: $6.5B total 2026; $725/ft Delaware, <$600/ft Utica, $750/ft Dorado
completions_strategy: Super Zipper zipper fracs with high fluid and proppant intensity. 10 completion crews across 4 plays. Completed lateral feet per day improving. 585 net wells planned in 2026. No specific CLF or acoustic diagnostics mentioned — EOG operates a large in-house technical team with proprietary completion designs.
seismos_relevance_detail: EOG's Super Zipper operations and high-intensity completions are the type of complex multi-well programs where perf efficiency (SAFA's primary metric) matters most. With 10 completion crews and 585 wells planned, even modest efficiency gains from CLF would be meaningful at scale. EOG's ML production optimizers show operator appetite for algorithmic decision-making. No direct CLF or acoustic mentions — EOG builds significant internal IP. A potential target customer but likely a hard enterprise sale.
notable_quote: We continue to improve total completed lateral feet per day while driving down well costs — targeting low single-digit improvements again in 2026 across all our major plays.

strategy_summary: Expand Energy (formerly Chesapeake + SWN) delivered 15% reduction in Haynesville breakevens in 2025 through evolved completion designs progressing from 'gen one' to 'gen three' and self-sourcing sand, while expecting sustainable first-year production gains in 2026. The company is shifting commercial focus to premium markets targeting $0.20/Mcf uplift (~$500M EBITDA) over 3-5 years and expanding 5 Bcf storage capacity. CEO sees natural gas demand growing 35-40% over five years and is focused on aggressive commercial execution.
capex_guidance: Maintenance capital ~$225M lower YoY for same ~7.5 Bcf/d production; flexible activity based on $3.50-$4.00 mid-cycle gas price view
basin_focus: Haynesville (primary, lowest breakeven improvements), Appalachian (Southwest Pennsylvania inventory), Gulf Coast marketing via NG3/Gillis
technology_mentions: Completion design evolution ('gen one' to 'gen three'); self-sourcing sand for completion outcomes; drilling efficiency improvements; 5 Bcf storage deployment

metrics_reported: 15% Haynesville breakeven reduction; $200M hedging gains 2025; 5 Bcf storage capacity; ~7.5 Bcf/d maintenance production level

Completion design optimization is central to their strategy ('gen one to gen three'). Haynesville is a Seismos target basin. Medium relevance as a prospective target account.

strategy_summary: Diamondback is running a $3.75B 2026 program tightly focused on Permian core Midland and emerging Barnett development. Continuous pumping at 4,500+ ft/day is a primary operational focus. Active surfactant trial program (60 wells at ~$500K/well) and stage design optimization underway. Barnett at $1,000/ft targeting $800/ft via learning curve. 15,000-ft laterals in Barnett.
capex_guidance: $3.75B total 2026; $510-520/ft Midland core, Barnett targeting $800/ft (from $1,000/ft)
technology_mentions: Continuous pumping (4,500+ ft/day average, up to 5,500 ft/day recorded)
completions_strategy: Continuous pumping is the primary efficiency driver — Diamondback treats downtime as the enemy. Simul-frac on longer laterals. Active surfactant trial to quantify oil uplift (60-well program). Stage design optimization to reduce cost per foot in Barnett from $1,000 to $800. No real-time diagnostics or acoustic monitoring mentioned.
seismos_relevance_detail: Diamondback's intense focus on continuous pumping (treating any stoppage as lost value) maps directly to Seismos's SAFA pitch — perf friction detection reduces NPT during plug-and-perf operations. With 4,500+ ft/day operations, even a 5% reduction in NPT from better perf efficiency is commercially significant. The 60-well surfactant trial also shows Diamondback is actively A/B testing completion technologies, suggesting openness to diagnostic tools that can quantify uplift. Barnett development at $1,000/ft gives a higher-cost target where optimization ROI is clear.
notable_quote: We achieved a 5,500-foot-per-day continuous pumping record in the Midland Basin — never underestimate the American engineer.

strategy_summary: Gulfport is focused on capital-efficient Utica and Marcellus dry/wet gas development with longer laterals averaging 16,900 feet in 2026, up from 13,500 feet. The company is completing a discretionary acreage acquisition program adding 2+ years of core inventory while returning over 100% of adjusted FCF to shareholders via buybacks.
capex_guidance: $400M-$430M total ($365M-$390M D&C, $35M-$40M land/seismic)
completions_strategy: Completion efficiency increased 26% from 2022-2025 but dipped in 2025 due to regional drought and spot crew utilization; frac efficiency averaged 18 hours/day. First U-development wells in Utica completed in Q4, brought online Q1 2026. Marcellus North wells planned with full science program (sidewall cores, logging, tests) to properly design fracs, completions deferred to 2027. Targeting 15,000-18,000 ft optimal lateral lengths. Utica D&C costs down to $920/lateral foot in 2026.
efficiency_metrics: Drilling footage/day improved 80% from 2022-2025. Completion efficiency up 26% over same period but dipped in 2025. Top-hole drilling shaved couple days/well. Utica D&C costs ~$920/lateral foot. Full-year 2025 D&C capital $428.4M. Q4 operating cash flow $222M, exceeding capex by 2x.
seismos_relevance_reason: Active completions operator focused on frac design optimization with science-driven approach (sidewall cores, logging for frac design). Completion efficiency dipped in 2025 and is a stated focus area. Collecting data to 'properly design fracs' in Marcellus North. However, no specific mentions of CLF, acoustic sensing, or real-time frac monitoring technologies.
notable_quote: Drilling footage per day improved by approximately 80% between 2022 and 2025, while completion efficiency increased 26% over the same period.

strategy_summary: Matador is prioritizing free cash flow over production growth, targeting 3% oil growth while cutting capex 11% to $1.50B. capex_guidance: $1.50 billion (down 11% YoY from $1.53B)
technology_mentions: produced water recycling (72% of frac water)
completions_strategy: Large-batch and longer-lateral completions front-loaded in H1 2026 (55-60% of full-year capex). Expanded surfactant program showing improved 150-day cumulative production vs. control wells. 72% of frac water sourced from produced water.

strategy_summary: Nine Energy is struggling with Permian Basin pricing pressure and market share losses in completion tools due to customer consolidation and casing size changes. The company is pivoting toward international markets (UAE, Argentina, Australia) and gas-levered basins (Northeast, Haynesville) while investing in new completion tool technology and a 30,000 sq ft manufacturing facility to regain competitiveness.

completions_strategy: Core completions services provider across cementing, wireline, completion tools, and coiled tubing. Facing headwinds from completion design changes (casing size shifts) and Permian pricing saturation. Completed landmark 400F+ cementing job in Haynesville. R&D team actively developing new completion tool technology to address market share losses. International completions revenue up 19% YTD.
efficiency_metrics: Q3 2025 revenue $132M (below $135M-$145M guidance). Adjusted EBITDA $9.6M. Net loss of $14.6M. Cementing jobs down 4%, wireline stages down 4%, completion tool stages down 27%. Liquidity $40.3M.
seismos_relevance_reason: Nine is a pure-play completions services company (cementing, wireline, completion tools, coiled tubing) operating in basins where Seismos is active. Their struggles with completion design changes and need for differentiation could make them receptive to frac diagnostic partnerships, though they don't currently mention any real-time monitoring technologies.

Wired pipe Downhole Broadband Services (DBS) doubled year-over-year in the North Sea, enabling high-frequency downhole data for faster decision-making. ATOM RTX robotics platform and digital solutions for drilling efficiency are growth areas. NA completions business softer on macro. Max Completions (Seismos partnership platform) not named explicitly in call.

High-frequency downhole data acquisition during drilling/completions
ATOM RTX robotics platform (rig floor automation)
Max Completions platform (Seismos partner — not named in call)
Intervention and stimulation capital equipment segment
completions_strategy: NOV's completions exposure is through capital equipment (stimulation equipment, intervention tools) and the Max Completions platform. DBS wired pipe provides high-frequency downhole data that enables faster rig-floor decisions — adjacent to Seismos's acoustic sensing approach but focused on drilling rather than fracturing. NA completions equipment market softer.

seismos_relevance_detail: NOV is a Seismos partner via Max Completions. The call did not mention Max Completions or Seismos by name, suggesting the partnership is not yet commercially material enough to feature in investor communications. DBS wired pipe technology is philosophically adjacent to Seismos's acoustic surface sensing — both capture high-frequency downhole signals to improve decision-making — but operate at different well phases (drilling vs. fracturing) and data capture points (downhole vs. surface acoustic). NOV's offshore/drilling orientation limits direct CLF overlap, but the partnership validates NOV's intent to expand completions intelligence offerings.
notable_quote: Downhole Broadband Services — our wired pipe technology — more than doubled year-over-year in the North Sea, enabling operators to capture high-frequency downhole data for faster decision-making during drilling operations.
